column4: I dont know how to configure my microphone to use skype in ubuntu 9.10
click on the speaker in the top right of your screen and go to 'sound preferences'
ok
and make sure you have the right input selected in the input tab
done
did you have to make any changes?
no
go back to the input tab in the sound preferences and see if the input level graph moves when you talk into the mic... also make sure its not muted at the top
it doesnt move while I talk
and its not mutted
is it just a mic plugged into the mic port on your sound card?
I'm using a laptop inspiron
is it a built in mic then?
yeap
its built in
I've been using it in windows
go into the hardware tab in the sound preferences, does it show "interntal audio", "analog stereo duplex" ?
internal*
yes, it show that
hmm, im not sure then, maybe try running 'hardware drivers' to see if you need a 3rd party driver
ok, What shoud I do and how?
go to the gnome menu, then under administration go to 'hardware drivers'
install any drivers it comes up with related to audio or multimedia, if this doesnt work restate your question in the channel and maybe someone else can help you
